text: this is what remains of the medicines on
frontier hospital in Kunduz a lifeline
for thousands in the city caught up in
the violence in the city of
mazar-e-sharif casualties are away from
danger but still in shock doctors were
about to take me to an operating theatre
when the bomb hit there were flames all
around me
I saw patients and doctors burn to death
it's the story of many patients who say
that gone there for treatment only to
find themselves under fire there was no
place to hide my father dragged me to
the basement at daybreak troops came and
took me out while other casualties have
made the journey all the way from Kunduz
to this emergency hospital here in Kabul
officials here tell us that they've
received 25 people initially some of
them seriously injured but that many
more are still coming in and as the
relentless fighting continues the exodus
from the city begins
Masuda was trapped in the basement of
her home for days with her seven
children as the fighting raged she told
me of the horror she saw we were out of
food for days when our house was bombed
we had to flee the city as we made our
way out I saw dead bodies everywhere
the battle for Kunduz continues and the
human cost is rising chimey Halil BBC
news Kabul
